page.title: 12Elsenham Quarry
page.content: need quite alot of protection. This protection is boots with steel toe caps, wellingtons with steel toe caps, two overalls, safety helmets, face masks, and ear muffs. The work hours for the quarry are 7am to 5pm and the work hours for truck drivers are 6am to 6pm. At the quarry animals from the nearby countryside have been seen running about. Also footprints and bodies of dead animals have been found. The animals are mainly foxes and muntjacks (small deer). Also there is said to be a wild mink that runs around the Elsenham Quarry. The quarry was first owned by Mr S A Facey and then it was owned by a company called Knights. In 1985 it was acquired by a company called Greenhams.
